text:
Opinion KILLED ON HOLIDAY First pics of Brit dad-of-two who died ‘after being hit with cleaner’s wet floor sign in fight at Tenerife hotel’ where he was celebrating his birthday 
Daryl Bhandal died of severe head injuries on Saturday morning By GERARD COUZENS Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments A BRIT holidaymaker who died after a fight at a Tenerife hotel where he was celebrating his birthday has been named as company director Daryl Bhandal. 
The dad-of-two, 36, lost his battle for life in hospital after being seriously injured in a fracas between two British couples said to have been sparked after he was hit with a cleaner’s wet floor sign. Solarpix Daryl Bhandal died of severe head injuries on Saturday while holidaying in Tenerife Solarpix 4 The dad-of-two sustained the fatal injuries during a fight with a British couple 
The incident happened around midnight on Friday at an unnamed hotel in the resort of Puerto de Santiago in the south west of the island. 
The suspected killer and his girlfriend, both British tourists said to have been involved in the violent altercation with the dead man and his partner, have been arrested.

Pals took to social media to pay tribute to Mr Bhandal, from Woolwich, south east London. 
One said of the keep fit fanatic, who ran a building firm: “Gutted to hear about Daryl Bhandal. 
“My thoughts are with his family and friends. RIP mate.” 
Graphic designer Brad Mulock added: “Daryl Bhandal. Unbelievable. Totally and utterly unbelievable. RIP mate.” 
Pal Richard Specter said: “RIP Daryl Bhandal. Absolute pleasure knowing you. Top bloke and a brilliant father. I know a lot of us are in shock and rightfully so. 
“And for everyone paying tributes, I’m sure it’ll be a huge comfort to his family to know he’ll be missed by so many people. Sleep tight big guy.” Solarpix The British company director was struck with a cleaner’s wet floor sign Solarpix 4 The couple involved in the fight with Bhandal have both been arrested 
Another Facebook post, written before the tragedy in the early hours of Saturday morning, revealed how Mr Bhandal had gone out with his young son and daughter on Boxing Day to hand out warm clothes to the homeless. 
Quality Solutions Group, the firm he was a director of, said it was footing the bill for all the clothes. 
Police on the island were not immediately available on Monday morning to comment on the two arrests. 
The man detained over Daryl’s death, who was reportedly held by local police as he tried to flee the scene, is understood to have received hospital treatment for minor facial injuries. 
His partner was held on suspicion of throwing the wet floor sign at Daryl during a verbal row which led to the violent altercation. 
The Brit building firm director was rushed to a hospital in the south of the island with severe head injuries but died around 3am on Saturday morning. 
A local judge has been put in charge of the case.
